State - Interface in gui
The state interface is used for the controller such that all states of the UI conform and can be treated the same way.
StateGenerating - Class in gui
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the second stage where the user sees a progress bar while a maze is generated by the factory.
StateGenerating() - Constructor for class gui.StateGenerating
Constructor uses default settings such that a Depth-First-Search algorithm is used as the generation method a maze of smallest possible size.
StatePlaying - Class in gui
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the third stage where the user plays the game.
StatePlaying() - Constructor for class gui.StatePlaying
Constructor uses default settings but does not deliver a fully operation instance, requires a call to start() and setMaze().
StateTitle - Class in gui
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the first stage where the user can select the skill-level.
StateTitle() - Constructor for class gui.StateTitle
Default constructor with internal constraint that method start is called before any calls to handleUserInput for handling user input.
StateWinning - Class in gui
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the final stage where the user sees the final screen and can restart the game.
StateWinning() - Constructor for class gui.StateWinning
Default constructor with internal constraint that method start is called before any calls to keydown for handling user input.
STEP_SIZE - Static variable in class gui.Constants
